text:
You minimize how fast technology compounds.

Take a guess on this question below:

1. How long did we go from domesticating horses to inventing steam machines (= industrial revolution)?

...

5,270 years of innovation. But...

2. ... How long did we go from the steam machine to building 1,000+ km/h deadly military planes?

...

220 years.

So it took 220 years for humanity to:

☑ Invent the steam machine (Watt, 1769)
☑ Invent electricity (Edison, 1897)
☑ Invent planes (Wright, 1903)
☑ Invent 1,000 km/h planes (1989)

And obviously AI isn’t waiting centuries:

☑ Coin the term “AI” (Dartmouth, 1956)
☑ Beat a world chess champion (Deep Blue, 1997)
☑ See better than humans (ImageNet victory, 2015)
☑ Write and code on demand (ChatGPT, 2022)
☑ Talk, see, and reason in real time (GPT-4o, 2024)

Next stop? 2030.

And the curve’s only getting steeper.
